cut down.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to reduce the amount of something
cut down.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Installing double-glazing will cut down the noise from traffic.
By getting the design right, you can cut down on accidents.
cut down.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to eat, drink, or use less of something, especially in order to improve your health
cut down.translation[0].definitions[1].e: I’ve always smoked, but I’m trying to cut down.
Cut down on fatty foods if you want to lose weight.
cut down.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to cut through the main part of a tree so that it falls on the ground
cut down.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to kill or injure someone, especially in a battle
cut down.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Hundreds of men were cut down by crossbow fire.
cut down.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to reduce the length of something such as a piece of writing
cut down.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Your essay’s too long – it needs cutting down a little.
cut down.translation[0].definitions[5].d: to make someone realize that they are not as important, successful etc as they think they are
